title: Query String Request for Condition
description: Task to seek a patient active conditions. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Completed Query String Request for Condition
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Completed Query String Request for Condition with Contained Output
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions using a contained resource for the output data. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Free Text Request for Condition
Completed Free Text Request for Condition
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions using free text for the input. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Coded Request for Progress note
description: Task to seek a patient's latest Progress notes.

title: Completed Coded Request for Progress note -PDF
description: Completed Task to seek a patient's latest Progress notes using a contained resource for the output data.

title: Completed Coded Request for Progress note -CCDA
Failed Coded Request for A1C Results
description: Task to seek a patient's HbA1c test results with a failed status.

title: Coded Request for A1C Results
description: Task to seek a patient's HbA1c test results.

title: Query String Request  for Condition with Authorization
description: Task to seek a patient active conditions with a reference to a formal authorization. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Completed Query String Request  for Condition with Authorization
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions with a reference to a formal authorization. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Free Text Request for Condition with Provenance
Completed Free Text Request for Condition with Provenance
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions and their provenance using free text for the input. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Query String Request for Condition with Provenance
Completed Query String Request for Condition with Provenance
description: Completed Task to seek a patient active conditions their provenance. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Query String Request for Signed Condition Data
description: Task to seek a patient active conditions using `Task.input` signature parameter to indicate a signature is required. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Completed Query String Request for Signed Condition Data
description: Completed Task to seek a *signed* patient active conditions. This example illustrates the use of business identifiers (instead of pointing to a FHIR resource) to references the various actors.

title: Claim Attachment Request Example
description: Claim Attachment Request sent by payer to a provider requesting a signed Progress note (H&P) note'

title: Prior-Auth Attachment Request Example
description: Prior Authorization Attachment Request sent by payer to a provider requesting a signed Progress note (H&P) note
